{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2996466,"name":"Ashton","username":"GOOFBOO","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-22T17:41:34.707Z","cooked":"

Has anyone done a 2 wheeled swerve drive with Omni wheels on the outside and the swerve modules in the middle? Would this be viable and if so would it move any different than a 4 wheeled swerve drive?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-22T17:41:34.707Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1040,"reads":572,"readers_count":571,"score":5319.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":401057,"topic_slug":"2-wheel-swerve-drive","display_username":"Ashton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/modified-h-drive-2-swerve-modules-4-passive-omnis/401319/3","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Modified H-drive - 2 Swerve modules + 4 passive omnis","clicks":3},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/what-if-you-only-had-2-swerve-pods/441173/16","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"What if you only had 2 swerve pods?","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50971,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2-wheel-swerve-drive/401057/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2996471,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-22T17:51:37.781Z","cooked":"

Actually… yes, someone has. I believe they used casters instead of omnis.

1114, back in 2004. @Karthik, wasn’t there a thread discussing that one somewhere around?

Though what you seem to be asking about is a 6-wheel version (omnis on the corners, drive in the middle). As far as I’m aware there’s a pretty good chance it handles differently than a normal 4WD (or 6WD) swerve but these things are rare enough that I wouldn’t know for sure.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-22T17:51:37.781Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":571,"readers_count":570,"score":164.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":401057,"topic_slug":"2-wheel-swerve-drive","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/2-wheel-swerve-drive/401057/2","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2996513,"name":"Richard Medina Fanclub","username":"Tyson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tyson/{size}/149442_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-22T19:02:06.436Z","cooked":"

3309 did 2 swerve module for 2021 IR@HC. Mark, our student lead programmer has comments below.

I want to emphasize the lack of traction with only 2 wheels of grip using WCP wheels and tan conveyor tread. After only 1 or 2 days of decent practice running, the tread was pretty bare and needed replacement to complete our competitions.

This layout was chosen specifically for the IR@HC and I wouldn’t consider it for a full FRC play.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-23T05:22:23.269Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":508,"readers_count":507,"score":146.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":401057,"topic_slug":"2-wheel-swerve-drive","display_username":"Richard Medina Fanclub","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48253,"username":"MarkGhebrial","name":"Mark Ghebrial","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/markghebrial/{size}/154083_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15068,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2-wheel-swerve-drive/401057/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2996514,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-22T19:02:36.806Z","cooked":"

While this is possible, it probably won’t behave exactly like a normal swerve drive. The problem is that, while the omni wheels will behave correctly on the x and y axes (i.e., parallel to and perpendicular to the axle of the omni) you’ll get much more resistance when moving on a diagonal, which means you have resistance in some directions but not others. How much this would affect performance is an open question and one you’ll probably have to test to find out, though it’s possible someone has actually tried it and knows the answer. The robot EricH mentions would behave much more like a normal swerve, assuming that it was using swivel casters.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-22T19:02:36.806Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":463,"readers_count":462,"score":132.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":401057,"topic_slug":"2-wheel-swerve-drive","display_username":"Stewart Riley","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32783,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I plan, therefore I am"},"post_url":"/t/2-wheel-swerve-drive/401057/5","custom_user_title":"I plan, therefore I am","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2996523,"name":"Ashton","username":"GOOFBOO","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-22T19:15:08.158Z","cooked":"

Was the programing of it any different than a 4 module swerve? Also what motors did you use for the drive?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-22T19:15:08.158Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":419,"readers_count":418,"score":138.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":401057,"topic_slug":"2-wheel-swerve-drive","display_username":"Ashton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":48253,"username":"MarkGhebrial","name":"Mark Ghebrial","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/markghebrial/{size}/154083_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50971,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2-wheel-swerve-drive/401057/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2996532,"name":"Richard Medina Fanclub","username":"Tyson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tyson/{size}/149442_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-22T19:27:10.674Z","cooked":"
3309 Swerve CAD
This year, Team 3309 has decided to test our luck with swerve. We researched other modules and isolated the features we wanted to include in ours. A few sources that influenced us are WCP and Swerve Specialties. There are a few major parts that will be 3d printed. (both of them being pulleys) As far as materials go, we plan on testing that on the field with different options. The module weighs around 4.35 pounds without falcons and 6.55 pounds with falcons. The reason for the odd shape is for …

Falcons.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-22T19:27:22.868Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":406,"readers_count":405,"score":116.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":401057,"topic_slug":"2-wheel-swerve-drive","display_username":"Richard Medina Fanclub","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/3309-swerve/391302","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"3309 Swerve","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":50971,"username":"GOOFBOO","name":"Ashton","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ed8c4c/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15068,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2-wheel-swerve-drive/401057/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2996536,"name":"Mark Ghebrial","username":"MarkGhebrial","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/markghebrial/{size}/154083_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-22T19:31:57.700Z","cooked":"

Programming with WPILib’s swerve kinematics classes it essentially the same for any number of modules.

We (team 3309) used a two-module swerve drive on our IR@home robot, and it worked really well.

However, that robot was both small and light, having a 20" by 20" frame and being light enough for one person to carry. Since only having two modules slices the available power and traction on half, I don’t recommend it on a full sized robot.

Also, the heading of that robot tends to drift when the robot changes direction, possibly because of inconsistencies between our custom modules and my unoptimized PID tuning. I suspect that having four modules would help reduce that heading drift, but I won’t know until I can get my hands on a four-module drivetrain.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2022-01-22T22:21:53.714Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":383,"readers_count":382,"score":116.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":401057,"topic_slug":"2-wheel-swerve-drive","display_username":"Mark Ghebrial","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/3309-swerve/391302","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"3309 Swerve","clicks":16}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":50971,"username":"GOOFBOO","name":"Ashton","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ed8c4c/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48253,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alumnus of Team 3309, the Friarbots"},"post_url":"/t/2-wheel-swerve-drive/401057/8","custom_user_title":"Alumnus of Team 3309, the Friarbots","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2996669,"name":"page2067","username":"page2067","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/page2067/{size}/3748_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-23T00:02:18.424Z","cooked":"

In 2015, a year with no defense…, We had a swerve, but desired to add can grabbers and were at the weight limit - 220Lbs, so we first dropped our drive motors from CIMs (2.8#s) to Mini-Cims (2 #'s), then not enough, so we got rid of 2 drive Mini-Cims, a net of 5.6 lbs., enough to add 2 pneumatic cylinders and can grab arms before Champs - it worked, and was a great trade for us in that weird year.
2 Swerves can provide full Holonomic drive. But not recommended with defense in the game !

@EricH I thought 1114 in 2004 was all four modules powered, but I could be wrong.

I believe 45 Technokats had the ball drive in 2003 that used two powered balls for omnidirectional motion, and I feel like I’ve seen a two “swerve” two caster drive from team 45 or 47 somewhere back around 1997-2000.

Not to my memory. To my recall they only had two modules…

Time to go poke around CD-Media for a minute or five.

Edit: After poking around CD-Media…pic: GM & Simbotics, 1114 -- Getting on the deck is about as good a shot as you can see. All 4 corners can elevate, and you can see the swerve on the near side, but it’s hard to tell what’s on the far side.

My high school team (6941) usually built prototype swerve drivebases with only two modules paired with unpowered caster wheels (like those on shopping carts or dolly carts).
From my experience I’m fairly confident that if you replace the omnis with freely rotating caster wheels the swerve would behave almost exactly the same as one with four modules. However, the robot would be quite underpowered and lose a lot of traction so this could be a pretty significant tradeoff depending on what your goals are.

4e098e05421a425bee126d5d0e4f81a1080×1920 834 KB

We usually put the two modules on diagonals but putting them in the middle should work too, as the imaginary line connecting the two modules would still pass the geometric center of the robot.

FRC47 introduced swerve in 98 and had two swerve modules in the center with Casters at the corners.

EricH:

1114, back in 2004. @Karthik, wasn’t there a thread discussing that one somewhere around?

Yup, our 2004 SimSwerve drivetrain used two power modules in the back (where most of the weight of the robot was), and two ball casters in the front. The tradeoff to go with only two modules was mainly based on the motor restrictions for that era. The modules each had a drill motor and FP motors for drive, and a globe motor for steering. Someone can correct me if I’m wrong, but I think the only legal motors in 2004 were: 2 Drills, 2 FPs, 2 CIMs, 2 Globes, 2 Windows, 1 Van Door, 1 Seat.

Considering how many motors and PDP slots teams have available at their disposal today, I definitely would not recommend doing a two module setup.

Here’s a link to the SimSwerve whitepaper that Ian wrote for as part of his work term report for Waterloo. White Paper Discuss: SimSwerve Omnidirectional Drive System

A lot of the links are broken in that thread, so let me add some media here.

Gearboxes on table2304×1728 764 KB

Gearbox with wires2304×1728 727 KB
Wheels extended2304×1728 858 KB
108701306928689×768 34.9 KB

More discussion:

pic: SimSwerve Omnidirectional Drive System Robot Showcase
[fb427e80ed275938f6b78a38320b3455_l.jpg] An exploded view of the SimSwerve omnidirectional drive system used by Simbotics (Team 1114) in 2004. For a white paper describing the drive system, and CAD models of the gearbox, go to: http://www.chiefdelphi.com/forums/papers.php?s=&action=single&paperid=354
pic: Team 1114 Gearboxes Robot Showcase
[15e66a71867196481e5b2c1ddb7046b8_l.jpg] Here are our 2004 gearboxes. Enjoy.

45 Ball drive for reference.
